meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's time to dive into the trenches with Men of War II, a World War II real-time strategy game that's got critics scrambling for their scorecards. But before we get started, let me just say that I'm feeling like a groovy little hippo today, and I hope you are too.

Now, onto the review! I've been playing around with Men of War II, trying to figure out if it's worth getting down in the mud or not. And honestly, I think it's a solid game, but it's not without its flaws. Let me break it down for you:

First off, the gameplay is where Men of War II really shines. You get to control your own units on the battlefield, making tactical decisions and trying to outmaneuver the enemy. It's deep, folks! There are so many little details to keep track of - resources, unit placement, support fire... it's a lot to handle at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's super satisfying.

But, as some critics have noted (ahem, Cubed3), the game can be a bit clunky. Controls are stiff, and the UI could use some work. And don't even get me started on that always-online requirement! I mean, I know it's meant to be fixed in an update or something, but come on - what if I just want to play offline for a little while?

Despite those issues, Men of War II still manages to impress. The graphics and sound design are top-notch, immersing you right into the midst of World War II. And let's not forget about the multiplayer aspect! Online battles with friends or foes can be super intense, especially if you're one of those masochistic RTS fans (ahem, PC Gamer).

So, is Men of War II worth your time? Well, that depends on how much you're willing to put into it. If you're a fan of the series or just looking for a good WWII RTS, I think this game is definitely worth checking out. But if you're new to the genre or not interested in digging deep into the gameplay, you might want to wait until some of those kinks get worked out.

That's my two cents, folks! Let me know what you think - are you ready to dive into the trenches and take on Men of War II?
